intro: Conomorpha loretensis, commonly known as the Loretto's conomorpha, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in countries like Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
